com.livelife.motolibrary

Class MotoConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.livelife.motolibrary.MotoConnection

  • public class MotoConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    The MotoConnection is a singleton class that manages the MOTO tiles setup and display
    usage: MotoConnection.getInstance().startMotoConnection(activity, deviceId);
    Author:
    Max Leggieri - DTU Playware

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> connectedTiles
      An ArrayList containing all the connected tiles ids
      boolean isChallenge 
      static int[] playerColor

      • startMotoConnection

        public void startMotoConnection(android.content.Context context)
        Starts a connection service between the device and the tiles
        Parameters:
        context - the Context used to starts the connection

      • stopMotoConnection

        public void stopMotoConnection()
        Stops the ANT connection and clear the connection service

                              long time)
        Triggered when a new ANT message is received
        Parameters:

      • addTileToConnected

        public void addTileToConnected(int tile)

      • removeTileToConnected

        public void removeTileToConnected(int tile)

      • isPairing

        public boolean isPairing()
        Return if the pairing state is active or not
        Returns:
        true if pairing is active.

      • pairTilesStart

        public void pairTilesStart()
        Starts the pairing process, the tiles in this state are spinning in red color. Press all the spinning tiles to pair the tiles to the Android device and then call pairTilesStop to end pairing. Note that every time you start the pairing the id index starts at 1.

      • pairTilesStop

        public void pairTilesStop()
        Stops the pairing procedure.

      • getRfFrequency

        public int getRfFrequency()
        Gets the current operating frequency. For example, if a network operating frequency is 2450MHz, the RF frequency value will be 50.
        Returns:
        The current frequency. The valid range will be getMinRfFreq() to getMaxRfFreq().

      • saveRfFrequency

        public void saveRfFrequency(int rfFreq)
        Save the current rf frequency in the device memory.
        Parameters:
        rfFreq - a valid number between getMinRfFreq() and getMaxRfFreq().

      • rfChangeReady

        public void rfChangeReady()
        Call it after rfChangeStop() to reset and restart the tiles with the new frequency.

      • rfChangeStop

        public void rfChangeStop()
        Stops the rf change procedure

      • setMinRfFreq

        public void setMinRfFreq(int minRfFreq)

      • setMaxRfFreq

        public void setMaxRfFreq(int maxRfFreq)

      • getMinRfFreq

        public int getMinRfFreq()
        Gets the minimum frequency allowed for the device.
        Returns:
        The minimum frequency allowed for the device.

      • getMaxRfFreq

        public int getMaxRfFreq()
        Gets the maximum frequency allowed for the device.
        Returns:
        The maximum frequency allowed for the device.

      • rfChangeStart

        public void rfChangeStart()
        Starts the frequency change procedure. Usage: 
        
 int min = getMinRfFreq();
 int max = getMaxRfFreq();

 int currRF = (value between min and max);

 rfChangeStart();
 saveRfFrequency(currRF);
 connection.rfChangeStart();

 Handler h = new Handler();
 h.postDelayed(new Runnable() {
  public void run() {
 		rfChangeStop();
 		rfChangeReady();
 	}
 }, 3000); // in millis

      • updateFirmwareStart

        public void updateFirmwareStart()
        Starts the firmware update procedure, note that after calling this the rest of the procedure has to be done outside the device with the specified ANT software.

      • updateFirmwareStop

        public void updateFirmwareStop()
        Stops the firmware procedure.

      • setAllTilesToInit

        public void setAllTilesToInit()
        Call this function to put the the tiles in the init mode. In this mode the device will check the active tiles and populate the connectedTiles array.

      • setAllTilesColor

        public void setAllTilesColor(int color)
        Set all the tiles to a specific color. Colors are defined in AntData, eg. AntData.LED_COLOR_RED
        Parameters:
        color - the color constant.

      • setAllTilesColor

        public void setAllTilesColor(int color,
                             boolean release)
        Set all tiles to a specific color, using true as the release param activates the release messages in the callbacks.
        Parameters:
        color - the color constant.
        release - a boolean value for getting the release messages.

      • setAllTilesColors

        public void setAllTilesColors(byte[] colors)
        Use it if you want to set all the tiles with different colors. The number of colors has to be the same size of the connectedTiles array size.
        Parameters:
        colors - a byte array of color constants.

      • setTileColor

        public void setTileColor(int color,
                         int tileId)
        Set a specific tile to a color.
        Parameters:
        color - the color constant.
        tileId - the tile id.

      • setTileColorRelease

        public void setTileColorRelease(int color,
                                int tileId)
        Set a specific color for a tile with the release messages activated.
        Parameters:
        color - the color constant.
        tileId - the tile id to set.

      • setTileColorCountdown

        public void setTileColorCountdown(int color,
                                  int tileId,
                                  int speed)
        Set a specific tile in countdown mode.
        Parameters:
        color - the color constant.
        tileId - the tile id to set.
        speed - the speed of the countdown. Accepted values are: 60 (slow), 40 (medium), 20 (fast), 10 (ultra).

      • setTileSingleLed

        public void setTileSingleLed(int color,
                             int tileId,
                             int ledIndex)
        Set only one led on a specific tile.
        Parameters:
        color - the color constant.
        tileId - the tile id to set.
        ledIndex - the led index to turn on (0 to 7).

      • setTileNumLeds

        public void setTileNumLeds(int color,
                           int tileId,
                           int numLeds)
        Set the number of leds active on a specific tile.
        Parameters:
        color - the color constant.
        tileId - the tile id to set.
        numLeds - the number of leds you want to activate (0 to 8).

      • setTileIdle

        public void setTileIdle(int color,
                        int tileId)
        Set a specific tile to idle state. In this state the tiles are not triggering any message on press.
        Parameters:
        color - the color constant.
        tileId - the tile id.

      • setTileBlink

        public void setTileBlink(int numBlink,
                         int color,
                         int tileId)
        Set a specific tile to blink.
        Parameters:
        numBlink - the number of blinks.
        color - the color constant.
        tileId - the tile id.

      • setTileHalfLeds

        public void setTileHalfLeds(int color,
                            int tileId)
        Set a specific tile to a 1 on - 1 off alternate pattern.
        Parameters:
        color - the color constant.
        tileId - the tile id.

      • setAllTilesIdle

        public void setAllTilesIdle(int color)
        Sets all tiles to an idle state. Tiles will not generate any PRESS/RELEASE event.
        Parameters:
        color - the color constant.

      • setAllTilesBlink

        public void setAllTilesBlink(int numBlink,
                             int color)
        Set all tiles blinking.
        Parameters:
        numBlink - the number of blinks.
        color - the color constant.

      • update

        public void update(AntData data)
        Updates the whole current data for a tile.
        Parameters:
        data - a valid AntData object.

      • printMessage

        public java.lang.String printMessage(byte[] message)
        Prints the ANT payload message in a readble format.
        Parameters:
        message - the byte array message
        Returns:
        a readable byte array string

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the number of active leds.

      • randomIdleTile

        public int randomIdleTile()
        Used to get a random tile from all the tiles connected. Remember to set the tiles to the idle state before using this function.
        Returns:
        the random tile id.

      • randomIdleTileWithTiles

        public int randomIdleTileWithTiles(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> tiles)
        Used to get a random tile from an idle list of tiles. Remember to set the tiles to the idle state before using this function.
        Parameters:
        tiles - an array of tiles id.
        Returns:
        the random tile id.

      • getCurrentDataForTile

        public AntData getCurrentDataForTile(int tile)
        Gets the current broadcast data running on a specific tile.
        Parameters:
        tile - the tile id.
        Returns:
        an AntData object.
